TEXT.TITLE: COMEX SILVER FUTURES SOAR AT OPENING
TEXT.BODY: Comex silver futures opened 15 to 18 cents higher and then retreated slightly as followthrough buying slowed. May was up 12.5 cents at 6.705 dlrs from a high of 6.75 dlrs. July was up 13.1 cents at 6.785 dlrs from 6.84 dlrs. Traders said large commission houses were buyers on the open but encountered profit-taking and a slowdown in orders. Some traders said the market is starting to look overbought technically and vulnerable to a correction. But they added that speculators continue to view the market as a good buy relative to gold.
